title: rclone: ftp tls handshake fail - no shared cipher
body:
<!--

We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

**STOP and READ**
**YOUR POST WILL BE REMOVED IF IT IS LOW QUALITY**:
Please show the effort you've put into solving the problem and please be specific.
People are volunteering their time to help! Low effort posts are not likely to get good answers!

If you think you might have found a bug, try to replicate it with the latest beta (or stable).
The update instructions are available at https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_selfupdate/

If you can still replicate it or just got a question then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

for a quick response instead of filing an issue on this repo.

If nothing else helps, then please fill in the info below which helps us help you.

**DO NOT REDACT** any information except passwords/keys/personal info.

You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.

Make sure to include a log obtained with '-vv'.

You can also use '-vv --log-file bug.log' and a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`



#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Can't connect to ftp with TLS since 1.69.2.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
root@OpenWrt:~# rclone.1.70.2 --version
rclone v1.70.2

os/version: openwrt 24.10.2 (64 bit)
os/kernel: 6.6.93 (aarch64)
os/type: linux
os/arch: arm64 (ARMv8 compatible)
go/version: go1.23.10
go/linking: dynamic
go/tags: none


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
Openwrt 24.10.x (arm64 based)
Windows 11 x86 64bit


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
linux server (centos 6) runing proftpd (1.3.3g)


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone -vv lsf starmoon: --config=/etc/rclone/rclone.conf


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

root@OpenWrt:~# rclone.1.70.2 -vv lsf starmoon: --config=/etc/rclone/rclone.conf
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.70.2" starting with parameters ["rclone.1.70.2" "-vv" "lsf" "starmoon:" "--config=/etc/rclone/rclone.conf"]
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "starmoon:"
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : Using config file from "/etc/rclone/rclone.conf"
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: Connecting to FTP server
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: dial("tcp","<starmoon_ftp>:21")
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: > dial: conn=117.84.102.242:54996->121.235.237.101:21, err=
2025/07/20 18:52:28 CRITICAL: Failed to create file system for "starmoon:": NewFs: failed to make FTP connection to "starmoon.org.cn:21": remote error: tls: handshake failure

==> /var/log/proftpd/proftpd.log <==
Jul 21 02:16:17 linux.localdomain proftpd[9032] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): FTP session closed.
Jul 21 02:16:29 linux.localdomain proftpd[9202] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): FTP session opened.

==> /var/log/proftpd/tls.log <==
Jul 21 02:16:29 mod_tls/2.4.2[9202]: TLS/TLS-C requested, starting TLS handshake
Jul 21 02:16:29 mod_tls/2.4.2[9202]: unable to accept TLS connection: protocol error:
(1) error:1408A0C1:SSL routines:SSL3_GET_CLIENT_HELLO:no shared cipher
Jul 21 02:16:29 mod_tls/2.4.2[9202]: TLS/TLS-C negotiation failed on control channel

==> /var/log/proftpd/proftpd.log <==
Jul 21 02:16:29 linux.localdomain proftpd[9202] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): FTP session closed.

=====================================
The above was tested with rclone 1.70.2 openwrt build. But I tested version 1.69.2 to 1.70.3 and beta v1.71.0-beta.8907 on both openwrt and on my windows desktop with same results.
rclone 1.69.1 works fine with same configuration files. See logs below.

root@OpenWrt:~# rclone.1.69.1 --version
rclone v1.69.1

os/version: openwrt 24.10.2 (64 bit)
os/kernel: 6.6.93 (aarch64)
os/type: linux
os/arch: arm64 (ARMv8 compatible)
go/version: go1.21.13
go/linking: dynamic
go/tags: none

root@OpenWrt:~# rclone.1.69.1 -vv lsf starmoon: --config=/etc/rclone/rclone.conf
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.69.1" starting with parameters ["rclone.1.69.1" "-vv" "lsf" "starmoon:" "--config=/etc/rclone/rclone.conf"]
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "starmoon:"
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : Using config file from "/etc/rclone/rclone.conf"
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: Connecting to FTP server
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: dial("tcp","<starmoon_ftp>:21")
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>n:21: > dial: conn=*fshttp.timeoutConn, err=
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: dial("tcp","121.235.237.101:60138")
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>n:21: > dial: conn=*tls.Conn, err=
movie/
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : 3 go routines active
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: closing 1 unused connections
==> /var/log/proftpd/proftpd.log <==
Jul 21 02:57:03 linux.localdomain proftpd[17167] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): FTP session opened.

==> /var/log/proftpd/tls.log <==
Jul 21 02:57:03 mod_tls/2.4.2[17167]: TLS/TLS-C requested, starting TLS handshake
Jul 21 02:57:03 mod_tls/2.4.2[17167]: TLSv1/SSLv3 connection accepted, using cipher AES128-GCM-SHA256 (128 bits)

==> /var/log/proftpd/proftpd.log <==
Jul 20 18:57:03 linux.localdomain proftpd[17167] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): Preparing to chroot to directory '/home/share'
Jul 20 18:57:03 linux.localdomain proftpd[17167] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): USER movierc: Login successful.


<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.
